programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees

programme.desc: Jim searches for potential landing strips at Brooks Range after unseasonably warm weather, while Femo and Ariel celebrate Johns return with an Eskimo feast

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska
programme.desc: Construction crews in Bethel race to complete Eras newest hangar before the winter snow arrives, but when Jim turns up to inspect their progress, he is less than impressed

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: Game Warden Eddins assists the local police with an animal cruelty case. Richards responds to a trespassing dispute and Roraback relocates a snapping turtle

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff heads to Texas to help out rescued animals after Hurricane Harvey. Back in Denver, a woman brings in Bear, who needs surgery after eating a sock

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete Nelson tackles a build for a couple searching for treehouse treasure, featuring a rope bridge and hidden compartments

programme.title: Dog Detectives
programme.desc: PC Gayles and his dog Thor are on the hunt for evidence to convict mobile phone thieves. In Glasgow, sniffer dog Eddie carries out his first search for a gun

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.sub-title: The Day the Homestead Caught Fire
programme.desc: Otto faces danger when a chimney fire threatens to destroy his cabin. Meanwhile, Atz Lee and Jane embark on a dangerous ice-fishing mission

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The ranch faces another crisis when the water supply freezes. Elsewhere, the Wolfpack must problem solve to get the house back on track in time for the deep freeze

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete Nelson tackles a build for a couple searching for treehouse treasure, featuring a rope bridge and hidden compartments

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Liz Pavlicek visits a house where more than 30 spaniels have been neglected, and is shocked by their appalling conditions

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: Fred Dibnah demonstrates the engineering and design skills that shaped Scottish baronial style. He visits Glamis Castle to show how the sandstone tower was transformed by Italian plasterers to resemble a fairy-tale castle, and the House of Dun near Montrose, designed by William Adam

programme.title: The Channel Tunnel - Life on the Inside
programme.desc: This edition explores why two tunnels are better than one and follows the catenary team every step of the way as they fix the overhead cables in the wet area of the tunnel. There is also a drivers eye view of the giant crossover doors that link one tunnel to another in the biggest undersea cave ever built. Also, the team meet Maurice, the tunnel travelling bulldog

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom and Barbara apply their creative talents when they try to make clothes out of nettles and wool, while Jerry has his eye on becoming the next managing director of JJM. Comedy, starring Richard Briers, Felicity Kendal, Penelope Keith and Paul Eddington

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: Jim Hacker prepares to make his first public broadcast as prime minister, but finds it is not so easy to speak to camera as he imagined. John Wells guest stars, alongside Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: Call My Bluff
programme.desc: Robert Robinson hosts a game of word definitions and deceptions. Captains Frank Muir and Patrick Campbell are joined by Tom Baker, Alan Coren, Gabrielle Drake and Miriam Stoppard. First broadcast 27 May 1977

programme.title: Face the Music
programme.desc: Joseph Cooper invites viewers to match their musical wits against Judith Jackson, Robin Ray and Patrick Moore. With guest musician Louis Kentner. First broadcast 21 November 1976

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: When Russia invaded Ukraine, a schoolteacher in a small industrial town picked up his camera and began filming covertly, becoming an unlikely dissident. His footage captures a portrait of how propaganda has seeped into everyday life in Russia, with patriotic lessons and military drills replacing regular classes, drawing children into the machinery of war

programme.title: Blood and Gold: The Making of Spain with Simon Sebag Montefiore
programme.desc: The historian uncovers the truth about Spains hero El Cid. He also investigates the attack on the city-state of Granada, waged by King Ferdinand and Queen Isabella, the horror of the Spanish Inquisition, and in the process discovers an unsettling story about one of his own ancestors

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: How to Write a Mills and Boon: Timeshift
programme.desc: Author Stella Duffy sets out to produce her own novel for Mills and Boon, the company that has become one of the biggest names in romantic fiction. She enlists the help of some avid fans in a challenging mission that takes her from London to Italy and offers an insight into the joy and frustration of writing

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: Fred Dibnah demonstrates the engineering and design skills that shaped Scottish baronial style. He visits Glamis Castle to show how the sandstone tower was transformed by Italian plasterers to resemble a fairy-tale castle, and the House of Dun near Montrose, designed by William Adam

programme.title: The Channel Tunnel - Life on the Inside
programme.desc: This edition explores why two tunnels are better than one and follows the catenary team every step of the way as they fix the overhead cables in the wet area of the tunnel. There is also a drivers eye view of the giant crossover doors that link one tunnel to another in the biggest undersea cave ever built. Also, the team meet Maurice, the tunnel travelling bulldog

programme.title: Henry VIII: Patron or Plunderer?
programme.desc: Part two of two. Historian Jonathan Foyle explores how the kings choices in art and architecture provide clues to his mental state in the 1530s. Following the monarchs break from Rome, divorce from Catherine of Aragon and subsequent marriage to Anne Boleyn in the hope of finally fathering an heir, his desperation for a new image was at its peak

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: Fred explores the work of the builders responsible for the waterways of Britain. Visiting the Leeds-Liverpool and Bridgewater canals, he explores their industrial history and demonstrates how early pioneers dug the canals and made them watertight, creating some of Britains finest engineering

programme.title: The Channel Tunnel - Life on the Inside
programme.desc: With the 25th anniversary well under way, there is some extreme painting going on at both ends of the tunnel - two murals that will link to each other across the sea. Cameras take a look at the catenary teams revolutionary new camera van that will transform the way they look for faults

programme.title: Archaeology: A Secret History
programme.desc: Richard Miles charts the history of archaeological breakthroughs in a mission to understand the ancient past. In the first programme, he explores how the profession began by trying to prove a biblical truth

programme.title: Thatcher: A Very British Revolution
programme.desc: A look at how Margaret Thatchers struggling public image was transformed in 1982 when Argentine forces occupied the British overseas territory of the Falkland Islands in the South Atlantic, with the triumph of the British forces making her reputation in the UK and around the world. On the home front she faced another challenge to her leadership from National Union of Miners, which called a UK-wide strike, while in 1984 the IRA bombed the Grand Hotel in Brighten in an attempt to kill her and her most senior colleagues

programme.title: The Falklands Play
programme.desc: Production of Ian Curteiss controversial drama which charts the political manoeuvring that went on behind the scenes of Margaret Thatchers government during the Falklands War. Patricia Hodge stars as the prime minister, with James Fox and John Standing. First aired in 2002

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: The team delves into the world of astronaut training, discovering what it takes to become a European Space Agency astronaut. As Europe looks to play a more prominent role in space exploration, the programme shines a spotlight on candidates pushing boundaries and preparing to represent Great Britain and Northern Ireland amongst the stars. Helen Sharman, the first British astronaut, joins Chris Lintott at the Science Museum to celebrate the opening of the new space gallery

programme.title: How to Get Ahead
programme.desc: The three-part documentary continues as writer and broadcaster Stephen Smith explores Renaissance Florence under the reign of Grand Duke Cosimo Medici, whose fledgling court prized the finer things in life. Successful courtiers had to have brains as well as brawn, and some looked to theorists like Niccolo Machiavelli for underhand ways to get ahead, while enlightened polymaths turned their minds to the heavens - and to ice-cream

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: Fred explores the work of the builders responsible for the waterways of Britain. Visiting the Leeds-Liverpool and Bridgewater canals, he explores their industrial history and demonstrates how early pioneers dug the canals and made them watertight, creating some of Britains finest engineering

programme.title: The Channel Tunnel - Life on the Inside
programme.desc: With the 25th anniversary well under way, there is some extreme painting going on at both ends of the tunnel - two murals that will link to each other across the sea. Cameras take a look at the catenary teams revolutionary new camera van that will transform the way they look for faults

programme.title: Archaeology: A Secret History
programme.desc: Richard Miles charts the history of archaeological breakthroughs in a mission to understand the ancient past. In the first programme, he explores how the profession began by trying to prove a biblical truth

programme.title: Thatcher: A Very British Revolution
programme.desc: A look at how Margaret Thatchers struggling public image was transformed in 1982 when Argentine forces occupied the British overseas territory of the Falkland Islands in the South Atlantic, with the triumph of the British forces making her reputation in the UK and around the world. On the home front she faced another challenge to her leadership from National Union of Miners, which called a UK-wide strike, while in 1984 the IRA bombed the Grand Hotel in Brighten in an attempt to kill her and her most senior colleagues

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Helen Skelton and Gordon Smart present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Steph McGovern ask how vulnerable 43-year-old Julius Matera ended up being left for dead in Eccles, Manchester. Plus, police urge any other victims of a male rapist to come forward

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The development progress of a large home in Barry in south Wales, a terrace in Nuneaton and a quirky one-bedroom flat in a Victorian former schoolhouse on the Isle of Wight

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross travels to Shrewsbury in Shropshire, where Tim Weeks and Ben Cooper provide expert help as the red and blue teams compete to see who can make the most profit at auction. Charlie goes round the fair quizzing members of the public on a rather unusual antique he has brought along

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Trace, Track, Get My Car Back
programme.desc: Tracker Neil hunts down a stolen pickup hidden on a remote industrial estate. But before he can seize it, he is confronted by a man claiming he bought the vehicle at an auction

programme.title: Lost and Found in the Lakes
programme.desc: The scuba team members dive to their greatest depth yet in search of a drone for a pair of heartbroken newlyweds and social media detective Mui tries to return a phone full of memories to its rightful owner. Crafter Lucy takes on a shattered teapot fished out of the water and attempts to make something special out of it

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson sets about finding the ideal Wye Valley property for a pair of house hunters. Having put their Portugal home on the market, they have recently been touring the UK in their camper van and are itching to settle down somewhere with more space inside and out

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Leather worker Suzie Fletcher and textile conservator Rebecca Bissonnet restore a jacket and collar that once belonged to a rescue dog that helped search for survivors of the Lockerbie bombing disaster. Carpenter Will Kirk fixes a table bought in 1975 by a couple who had just moved to the UK from India, Pete Woods is tasked with repairing a saxophone played by a semi-professional musician over a career that spanned the 1940s to the 1990s and cobbler Dean Westmoreland tackles a pair of rugby boots that dragged the ball over the try line and won the match for England in the Womens World Cup in the 1994/95 season

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz show where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret amount, which could be anything from zero to £4,000, before being thrown into a battle of wits, nerve and strategic gameplay across a series of challenging rounds

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Trevor Nelson for the quiz where contestants try to score as few points as possible. As ever, players attempt to come up with the answers no one else could think of on subjects including Winners of 2024

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Alex Jones present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Okie finds a new way to manipulate a situation and Ross is shocked by recent events. Elaine reveals her big plans to Yolande

programme.title: Stacey and Joe
programme.sub-title: Theres Life in the Old Dog Still
programme.desc: Stacey heads off to Lake Como to launch a new beauty product while Joe is left at home managing the kids, a poorly pooch and a long list of chores - so he invites his family over to help out. On Staceys return from Italy, Joe goes above and beyond to organise an epic date night - a singalong with one of Essexs biggest gospel choirs - and the family celebrate the arrival of summer with an epic pool party

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Stella feels the weight of recent events when her daughter arrives at school. Mitch finds himself in hot water after stepping in to help a struggling student and Dwayne returns to a mostly warm reception. Darius turns to Jack for guidance as he eyes a bigger role within the school

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Spotlight
programme.desc: Darragh MacIntyre investigates how global drugs cartels are using Ireland as a route to get hundreds of millions of pounds worth of cocaine into Great Britain and Europe

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: The funfair arrives at Waterloo Road as Darius tries to escape the fallout from his actions. Has his luck finally run out? Agnes uncovers a secret that could blow a familys world apart, and Dontes loyalties are tested by a discovery that could end a colleagues career

programme.title: William Shakespeares Romeo + Juliet
programme.desc: A city is divided by the conflict between two feuding families - the fathers are bitter business rivals, and the younger generation are continually fighting in the streets. The son of one household falls in love at first sight with his enemys daughter - but the vendetta threatens their secret romance. Baz Luhrmanns modern update of Shakespeares tragic love story, with Leonardo DiCaprio, Claire Danes, Pete Postlethwaite and Miriam Margolyes

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Helen Skelton present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Thirty years ago Janet Brown was bludgeoned to death in her home. Today, her children appeal to find her killer. Plus, how police in Wales caught a dangerous paedophile

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the development progress of properties in Carlisle, Rosyth in Fife and Shepherds Bush, west London

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Danny Sebastian hosts as two teams seek bargains at Wetherby Racecourse. Experts Caroline Hawley and Colin Young assist the competing sides in their endeavours. Away from the contest, Danny takes a tour of Sheffield Botanical Gardens, where trustee Jill Sinclair shows him some of the 5,000 species of plants and trees that inhabit this urban oasis. Created in the early 19th century, the gardens were once home to a captive bear and monkeys. In more recent years they fell into disrepair before being restored in 2007

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Trace, Track, Get My Car Back
programme.desc: Intelligence officer Adam finds a shipping container full of stolen cars in Felixstowe and tracker Richard searches for a heavy-duty roller stolen from a Bristol construction site. Plus, footage of thieves stealing a Range Rover from a driveway in Essex

programme.title: Lost and Found in the Lakes
programme.desc: The team battle the elements as they search for graduation pictures lost by a newly-qualified doctor and social media detective Mui makes a valuable discovery

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Having returned to the UK, a young couple crave the outdoors lifestyle they experienced together for nearly three years living in New Zealand. Nicki Chapman helps them find a new home in the countryside of North Yorkshire, where they want to spend their spare time running, cycling and walking

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Cobbler Dean Westmoreland repairs a pair of boots belonging to blind photographer Ian, who was born profoundly deaf and lost his sight at 14. Metal worker Dominic Chinea is tasked with restoring a printing press from 1826 and the Bear Ladies give new life to a stuffed teddy that brought comfort to barn visitor Irwin at every hospital trip after he contracted polio at the age of three. Steve Fletcher and Cindy Welland repair a clock gifted to a school by Florence Nightingale in 1877

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz show where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret amount, which could be anything from zero to £4,000, before being thrown into a battle of wits, nerve and strategic gameplay across a series of challenging rounds

programme.title: Pointless

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Vernon Kay present the magazine show, with celebrity guests and stories of interest from around the UK

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Ravi steps up for his family and Nigel accidentally offends. Elaine gives Johnny food for thought

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: John from Holywell brings in a detailed working model of a Welsh coal mine, built by his miner grandfather more than 100 years ago. Its up to horologist Steve Fletcher to fix the mechanism while art conservator Lucia Scalisi restores its painted surfaces. The rest of the team get to work on a tattered Victorian writing box once owned by a trailblazing female journalist, a treasured 75-year-old doll and an extraordinary piece of British engineering history - the original 1930s design for the Humber Bridge

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors
programme.desc: After the first banishment sends shockwaves throughout the castle, the traitors dont wait long to commit their next murder. As a new day dawns, the celebrity players turn their focus to a mission that forces them to work very closely as a team under punishing conditions. But as night falls, will they continue to collaborate at the round table and catch a traitor, or will they inadvertently banish a fellow faithful? Presented by Claudia Winkleman

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Nolan Live
programme.desc: Stephen Nolan probes the issues that matter to the people of Northern Ireland, focusing on the stories of the week and the people making the headlines in lively debates, with viewers sending in their questions via text, email and social media

programme.title: Film Club
programme.desc: Evie is still reeling from the message she saw on Noas phone. But when the two are left alone together, something extraordinary happens. Is it the start of a new journey for Evie? Drama, starring Aimee Lou Wood and Nabhaan Rizwan

programme.title: Film Club
programme.desc: Evie throws herself headlong at life, but Suz and Josh worry its too much, too soon. Noa realises he has to face up to his feelings. Drama, starring Aimee Lou Wood, Suranne Jones, Adam Long and Nabhaan Rizwan

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Jo Brand is host, with panellists comedian Nabil Abdulrashid and journalist Tom Peck joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop as they delve into the news

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: The team takes a look at America and its various Presidents, from George Washington to the present day, including President Jacksons rude parrot

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Songs and sketches about the most ruthless rulers of all time, featuring Henry VIII, Louis XIV and the Vikings

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Presenters Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May shop for second-hand convertibles, uncovering the pitfalls to avoid when buying a used car, and Jeremy also gets the opportunity to test-drive the Pagani Zonda R. Actor Simon Pegg takes to the track in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Our Girl
programme.desc: Captain James and 2 Section are horrified when they hear about what has happened to Georgie, and it is not long before the situation takes a dramatic turn for the worse. The pressure is on as the team races against the clock, but it remains to be seen whether they will reach her in time. The military drama returns, this time following Lance Corporal Georgie Lane as she joins 2 Section at a refugee camp near the border of Somalia. Starring Michelle Keegan, Ben Aldridge, Anna Tenta and Michael James

programme.title: Film Club
programme.desc: Evie is still reeling from the message she saw on Noas phone. But when the two are left alone together, something extraordinary happens. Is it the start of a new journey for Evie? Drama, starring Aimee Lou Wood and Nabhaan Rizwan

programme.desc: Evie throws herself headlong at life, but Suz and Josh worry its too much, too soon. Noa realises he has to face up to his feelings. Drama, starring Aimee Lou Wood, Suranne Jones, Adam Long and Nabhaan Rizwan

programme.title: Twisted Metal
programme.desc: John and Quiet find themselves caught in a trap. Agent Stone tests the loyalty of his new recruits

programme.title: Twisted Metal
programme.desc: John strikes a dangerous deal in order to get desperately needed supplies. Quiet questions her future

programme.title: Bones and All
programme.desc: Teenager Maren learns from her absent father that she may have inherited her hunger for human flesh from the biological mother she has never known. Maren embarks on a quest to track down the missing matriarch and crosses paths with a young man who shares her grisly compulsion. Horror romance, starring Taylor Russell, Timothee Chalamet, Mark Rylance and Michael Stuhlbarg

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Presenters Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May shop for second-hand convertibles, uncovering the pitfalls to avoid when buying a used car, and Jeremy also gets the opportunity to test-drive the Pagani Zonda R. Actor Simon Pegg takes to the track in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: Tommys fight for redemption continues, but this time, its a battle for his own mind. Struggling to secure a new opponent, he knows a comeback fight is crucial for his mental health. Meanwhile, Molly-Maes new series trailer drops, pushing Tommy to face his own truths in the toughest interview of his life, where he opens up about his battle with alcohol addiction. Back in training, hope returns as a potential fight looms, leading him and his father John to a career-defining meeting

programme.title: My Mates a Bad Date
programme.desc: Twenty-five-year-old Mancunian Tyler is a self-confessed serial dater who treats dating like a sport and goes on five or six dates a week. Shes rude and sarcastic, rambles on about herself, gets bored easily and doesnt stay focused on her dates. Here, she wants to find the male version of herself, so Oloni puts that idea to the test by setting her up on three challenging dates

programme.title: The Catch Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the days news

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Afterlife
programme.desc: When a single mum and her two kids arrive in a small town, they begin to discover their connection to the original Ghostbusters and the secret legacy their grandfather Egon Spengler left behind. Supernatural comedy sequel, directed by Jason Reitman and starring Carrie Coon, Paul Rudd, Finn Wolfhard and Mckenna Grace, with cameo appearances by Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd, Ernie Hudson, Annie Potts and Sigourney Weaver

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: The ultimate hunt for the best new British comic begins as 30 hopefuls battle it out across six heats to earn a place at the Final, where one will be crowned the BBC New Comedian of 2025. Josh Jones hosts the West heat at St Georges, a multi-purpose, fully accessible live music and arts venue in the heart of Bristol. Carwyn Blayney, Will Owen, Omari Douglas, Jess Carrivick and Alfie Dundas take to the stage in a bid to impress judges Priya Hall, Harriet Dyer and Fatiha El-Ghorri

programme.title: Stacey and Joe
programme.sub-title: Theres Life in the Old Dog Still
programme.desc: Stacey heads off to Lake Como to launch a new beauty product while Joe is left at home managing the kids, a poorly pooch and a long list of chores - so he invites his family over to help out. On Staceys return from Italy, Joe goes above and beyond to organise an epic date night - a singalong with one of Essexs biggest gospel choirs - and the family celebrate the arrival of summer with an epic pool party

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Stella feels the weight of recent events when her daughter arrives at school. Mitch finds himself in hot water after stepping in to help a struggling student and Dwayne returns to a mostly warm reception. Darius turns to Jack for guidance as he eyes a bigger role within the school

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: The funfair arrives at Waterloo Road as Darius tries to escape the fallout from his actions. Has his luck finally run out? Agnes uncovers a secret that could blow a familys world apart, and Dontes loyalties are tested by a discovery that could end a colleagues career

programme.title: William Shakespeares Romeo + Juliet
programme.desc: A city is divided by the conflict between two feuding families - the fathers are bitter business rivals, and the younger generation are continually fighting in the streets. The son of one household falls in love at first sight with his enemys daughter - but the vendetta threatens their secret romance. Baz Luhrmanns modern update of Shakespeares tragic love story, with Leonardo DiCaprio, Claire Danes, Pete Postlethwaite and Miriam Margolyes

programme.desc: Michaels Pyrenean quest continues with the physical challenge of the French High Pyrenees, which he enters at the Cirque du Gavarnie, a 1,700-metre-high wall of limestone forming a natural amphitheatre. He struggles on across the snowy Plateau de Saugue to meet Marion Clignet, a French Olympic cycling champion who refused to let her epilepsy curtail her career, as well as finding time to reflect on his time as defence secretary, and on the current war in Europe

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Call the Bailiffs: Time to Pay Up
programme.desc: Agents Mark and Sam try to recover over £11,000 from a cleaning business that owes money to an ex-employee after an employment tribunal ruled that she had been dismissed unfairly. Vlad is tasked with retrieving a debt of over six grand from a catering and party planning business, and Lewis attends the address of a debtor who has not kept up on repayments on her debt of over £4000

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Officers are on the lookout for a suspected cloned car, a vehicle disguised as another by copying its number plate, as they believe it is being used to commit crime. When its spotted, four suspects make a run for it, and one is recognised as someone who rammed a police car weeks before. On the M1, officers tail a car linked to a known repeat offender and as several units pull over the car, the driver suddenly jumps into the back seat. Searching the vehicle, the cops make a worrying discovery

programme.title: Coastguard SOS: Search and Rescue
programme.desc: Out in the Baltic Sea, a UK-registered vessel collides with a Danish-registered ship, capsizing it and leaving two crew members missing and feared dead. A fishing trawler sends out a distorted mayday in the North Sea, suggesting it is taking on water. In Cornwall, Penzance Coastguard Rescue Team is called to a casualty who has fallen on a coastal path

programme.title: Dead Man Walking: Inside Death Row
programme.desc: Dan Walker embarks on a hard-hitting investigation to uncover the truth about capital punishment in the US. He explores the reality of life on death row and secures the access to see exactly what is involved in carrying out a state-sanctioned execution. Reflecting on his findings, Dan considers whether the UK could or should ever reinstate the death penalty

programme.title: Wandsworth Prison: Out of Control
programme.desc: An investigation into one of Britains most troubled jails, where men are sharing cells designed to hold one person, and inexperienced staff are struggling to cope. This leads to a multitude of other problems, including locking inmates up 23 hours a day, which turns them on to drugs or affects their mental health. Last year the Chief Inspector of HM Prisons declared emergency action was needed, prompting the Government to stump up £100million - but in spite of this, the Victorian prison appears on the brink of collapse

programme.title: Car Pound Cops: Give Me My Car Back!
programme.desc: In the Northampton office, a barman driving without business insurance faces a substantial fine before he can get his car back

programme.title: PlayOJO Live Casino Show
programme.desc: Interactive gambling for viewers

programme.title: Jason Watkins and Lady Jane Grey: A Tower of London Special
programme.desc: The actor tries to find the truth behind two family mysteries, with historian Tracy Borman helping discover whether he is related to John Brydges, the royal courtier responsible for overseeing the imprisonment and execution of Lady Jane Grey, Englands shortest-reigning queen. According to family legend, Jason could also be connected to another, even more famous figure, renowned Georgian author Jane Austen

programme.title: Churchill
programme.desc: It is 1945, and Winston Churchill has led Britain to the brink of victory, but he is determined to carry on as prime minister and calls a general election. He fully expects voters to give him another five years in Number 10, but he is in for a shock. Once the election is called the tide begins to turn, and Churchill struggles on the campaign trail

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: The couples take some time apart as the group splits in two for separate days out. But the relaxation soon turns to drama when one groom confesses his true feelings about his bride, and the burden of a long-hidden secret causes an explosive clash for one pair

programme.title: Below Deck Sailing Yacht
programme.desc: After kissing Danni, Gary tries to correct course, but not before Daisy finds out and gives him a piece of her mind. And a group of dentists board the boat

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart volunteers to go cycling with Marge on her new tandem, only to be laughed at by local bullies who accuse him of being a mummys boy. Meanwhile, Moe has the bright idea of entering Homer in an arm-wrestling competition

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: After spending the holidays apart, the gang get together to hear about Sheldons and Amys trip to his mothers, Leonard and Penny recall their Christmas tree adventure, and Howard and Bernadette open up about their first days as parents

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon tests a newly invented device after hearing that it can help him to read peoples emotions. Raj gathers his ex-girlfriends together so that they can give him some dating advice

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillos journey from the Irish Sea to the North Sea continues by tram from Manchester. programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: 13 Rue Madeleine
programme.desc: Veteran officer Robert Sharkey is recruited to train a team of intelligence service agents. When one of them turns out to be a German mole, Sharkey feeds him misinformation to take back to the Gestapo. However, the rogue spy outsmarts his peers and murders an agent. Without time to recruit a replacement, Sharkey steps in to head a dangerous mission in the heart of Nazi-occupied France. Second World War thriller, with James Cagney, Richard Conte, Walter Abel, Frank Latimore and Annabella

programme.title: The Violent Men
programme.desc: A ruthless cattle baron sets out to create his own private empire, no matter what the cost. When he resorts to murder, he makes an enemy of a civil war veteran, while his lust for power drives his wife into the arms of his younger brother. Western, starring Edward G Robinson, Barbara Stanwyck and Glenn Ford

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: When works of art start disappearing, stolen by a master thief, Father Brown attempts to catch the culprit and save his soul. Comedy drama, starring Alec Guinness, Joan Greenwood and Peter Finch

programme.title: A Christmas Carol
programme.desc: Miser Ebenezer Scrooge is given a Christmas Eve to remember when a quartet of ghosts - his dead business partner and the spirits of Christmases past, present and future - turn up determined to cure him of his money-grubbing ways. Adaptation of Charles Dickens classic, starring George C Scott, Nigel Davenport, Frank Finlay, Angela Pleasence, David Warner, Edward Woodward and Susannah York

programme.title: Ad Astra
programme.desc: Three decades ago, Clifford McBride led a voyage into deep space, but the crew were never heard from again. Now his son, Roy, embarks on a daring mission to Neptune to uncover the truth about his missing father and a strange power surge that threatens the stability of the universe. Director James Grays sci-fi drama, starring Brad Pitt, Tommy Lee Jones and Ruth Negga

programme.title: A Man Called Otto
programme.desc: A man whos given up on life following the loss of his wife and wants to end it all. When a young family moves in nearby, he meets his match in quick-witted Marisol, leading to a friendship that will turn his world around. Comedy drama, starring Tom Hanks, Mariana Trevino and Rachel Keller

programme.title: Nuns on the Run
programme.desc: Two small-time crooks decide to go straight and steal a fortune from their furious crime kingpin boss - who had in turn stolen it from equally disgruntled Chinese gangsters. Needing somewhere to lay low, they pose as nuns - but fitting in in a convent proves tricky. Comedy, starring Eric Idle, Robbie Coltrane and Camille Coduri

programme.title: The Eyes of Tammy Faye
programme.desc: Tammy Faye Grover is raised in a blended family of eight children in International Falls, Minnesota. In 1960 at North Central Bible College, she meets elevangelist Jim Bakker and they forego studies to marry and establish a travelling ministry, which leads to a big break on the Christian Broadcasting Network. True-life drama, starring an Oscar-winning Jessica Chastain, with Andrew Garfield and Cherry Jones

programme.title: Time Lock
programme.desc: A boy manages to get himself locked in a bank vault. With 63 hours before the device opens, the authorities are left facing a race against time to free the lad before he runs out of air. Thriller, starring Robert Beatty, Betty McDowall, Vincent Winter, Lee Patterson and a young Sean Connery in an early role

programme.title: They Rode West
programme.desc: A cavalry doctor is determined to help deal with a malaria epidemic on a Kiowa reservation. However, his fellow soldiers disapprove of his compassionate attitude, while the tribes medicine man resents outside interference. When the Native Americans attack the fort, the medic is branded a traitor. Western, starring Robert Francis, Donna Reed, May Wynn and Phil Carey

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: Felix and Tony run a tramp steamer together in the West Indies, but their seemingly unshakeable friendship is tossed aside when they both fall in love with the same woman. Tony tries to undermine his rival by exposing his illegal activities, while Felix responds with deadly intent. Romantic drama, starring Rita Hayworth, Robert Mitchum and Jack Lemmon.

programme.title: Roman Holiday
programme.desc: A princess tires of a tour of European capitals and runs away from her entourage while in Rome. An American newspaper reporter takes her under his wing in the hope of getting an exclusive, but as he shows her the sights of the city, he starts to fall in love with her. Romantic comedy, starring Audrey Hepburn, Gregory Peck, Eddie Albert and Harcourt Williams

programme.title: Sleepless in Seattle
programme.desc: A widowed father is coping badly with his wifes death, but his son is convinced that what he really needs is some new romance in his life. He arranges for his dad to go on a radio phone-in show, and his touching story moves a reporter to respond, even though she is already engaged. She returns to her fiance, but the boy, certain she is the woman for his father, plots to bring them together. Romantic comedy, with Tom Hanks and Meg Ryan

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: A convicted child-killer of towering height and massive build is condemned to death row, but astonishes the guards with his good nature and miraculous healing powers. They believe the gentle giant is incapable of crime, and emotions run high as they realise there is no hope of overturning his death sentence. Supernatural drama, based on a novel by Stephen King, starring Tom Hanks, Michael Clarke Duncan, David Morse and Harry Dean Stanton

programme.title: The Last King of Scotland
programme.desc: A Scottish doctor takes an overseas job in 1970s Uganda, just as notorious dictator Idi Amin comes to power. The naive medic is soon occupying a privileged position in the presidents inner circle, but as Amins erratic behaviour intensifies, he slowly becomes aware of the horrific campaign of violence and murder being committed by the despot. Political thriller, starring an Oscar-winning Forest Whitaker alongside James McAvoy and Gillian Anderson

programme.desc: Liam returns to a surprise when he finds Carla in charge of the factory. Eileen tries to find out where she stands with Pat and Leanne discovers the cost of big business.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: With the estates future hanging in the balance, Mary hopes to receive a bailout from her grandmother Martha - and with Violets help, tries to make sure Downton puts on a bigger show than ever before with a grand party for friends and neighbours. Meanwhile, Mrs Hughes hears worrying news, and OBriens efforts to boost Alfreds progress meets with disapproval from Thomas. Costume drama, starring Michelle Dockery, Shirley MacLaine and Maggie Smith

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: After reaching breaking point with being followed around by Buddy, Martin resolves to find a vet to have it put down, while Ruth finds out that Bert has been trying to make his own whisky. Clive is suspicious of Mrs Tishell and who she might be cooking meals for, Penhale makes a hash of asking Janice out, and Louisa and Martins therapy homework results in a picnic on the beach, where they are interrupted by local vet Angela Sim - who appears to be hallucinating. Comedy drama, guest starring Caroline Quentin

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An investigation into the appearance of forged bank notes in Aidensfield leads to the discovery of a major crime operation, and Blaketon is persuaded to try a new image by Vernon _ with unfortunate repercussions. Meanwhile, Mikes suggestion that he and Jackie start a family is not met with the expected response. Rural police drama, starring Geoffrey Hughes and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The constabulary receives help from the Met to target a local drug trafficker, believed to be the boyfriend of Lord Ashfordlys sister Patricia. Meanwhile, a domestic drama involving Jackies friend and her baby leaves Mike torn between the loyalties of work and home, and Vernon plans to take advantage of a postal strike. Rural police drama, starring Fiona Dolman and Jason Durr

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A planning dispute leads to murder after a stalwart in the Midsomer Conservation Society suspects her neighbours are involved in a money-making development scam. Guest starring Hugo Speer (Bleak House), with John Nettles, Jason Hughes and Jane Wymark

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A depressive gambler is found dead, the apparent victim of suicide. Dr Jane Moore, who once treated the man, is adamant he wouldnt have taken his own life - a theory backed up by the post-mortem. Thrilled to be working with Jane again, Barnaby investigates the case - and it isnt long before another of the doctors patients is killed. Detective drama, starring John Nettles, Isla Blair, Jan Ravens and Daniel Casey

Psychological thriller, starring Robson Green

programme.desc: A carpenter is rushed to St Georges after partially severing his hand with a power saw, a farmer is kept under observation after puncturing his lung in a quad-bike accident, and a man suffers an unexpected electric shock from a heart implant that was installed after he survived a stab wound. programme.title: Tales of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
programme.sub-title: Splinter and April Fight a Goldfish
programme.desc: The heroes in a half shell come to terms with their new roles as saviours of New York City in an animated series set shortly after the events chronicled in the film Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutant Mayhem. Donatello (voiced by Micah Abbey), Leonardo (Nicolas Cantu), Michelangelo (Shamon Brown Jr) and Raphael (Brady Noon) experience the usual growing pains of teenagers while contending with the media spotlight. Building on their friendship with aspiring reporter April ONeil (Ayo Edebiri), the reptilian quartet face brilliant inventor Bishop (Alanna Ubach), who believes mutants are the greatest danger facing humankind and must be eliminated. Meanwhile, pampered rich kid Rod (Pete Davison) yearns to be a mutant and leverages his wealth and connections to achieve a dangerous dream

programme.title: Sonic Prime
programme.desc: The wise-cracking blue hedgehog, made famous by a series of popular video games on Sega consoles, continues his computer-animated adventures through the Shatterverse. At the end of the first series, the eponymous spiny mammal (voiced by Deven Mack) learnt from black hedgehog Shadow (Ian Hanlin) that the original version of Green Hill no longer exists. Sonic is trapped in a multiverse of mayhem with different iterations of his friends Amy Rose (Shannon Chan-Kent), Knuckles (Adam Nurada), Rouge (Kazumi Evans) and Tails (Ashleigh Ball). Sonic and Shadow must put aside their differences and work together to repair the temporal damage and outwit diabolical scientist Dr Eggman (Brian Drummond)

programme.desc: Drew and Tee visit Insect Circus in Suffolk, where they discover a giant pair of 20th century stage shoes and scratch-made models of fairground rides

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore unearths a pair of floral chairs, a chipboard chest of drawers and a collection of antique hardware from the rubbish heap, hoping to breathe new life into them and make some cash for the original owners

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Charles Hanson and Natasha Raskin Sharp head south to Hertfordshire in the super glam 1932 Riley Monaco. Charles takes part in a whirlwind shopping dash and also finds time to travel to Waddesdon in Buckinghamshire and the home of Baron Ferdinand De Rothschild. Natasha spends over £300, including a Victorian ink and wash painting of a grumpy girl and a stunning 19th-century Italian bronze vase

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie Cooper and Tim Medhurst explore Cumbria in a campervan, picking up a Scots Guards picture, a rare Scottish jug, and some silver jewellery

programme.title: The Yorkshire Auction House
programme.desc: Angus helps an antiques dealer clear her home of treasures to fund a holiday. He also assists a woman sell her late uncles collection of spoons

programme.title: The Yorkshire Auction House
programme.desc: Angus visits an ex-soldier with a collection of vintage Action Man figures. A football fanatic wins big when he sells his Crystal Palace memorabilia

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Its crunch time for antiques experts Izzie Balmer and Tim Medhurst as they conclude their epic road trip around Wales. Tim goes on a veritable spending spree that includes an arts and crafts letter box, while Izzie hopes that two Chinese vases bearing the symbol for good fortune will prove to be an auspicious purchase

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: James Braxton and Irita Marriott cruise through Kent in search of antiques, and settle on a 19th-century childs rattle and a damaged glass lamp as likely to make a profit

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Joe Lycett welcomes 12 contestants to the amateur sewing competition. First up, the sewers are challenged to create seemingly straightforward wardrobe staples, and for their pattern challenge, the judges ask them to make a wrap skirt. Finally, the contestants attempt to make their first made-to-measure garment, a tea dress

programme.title: Dog Squad
programme.desc: Hearing dog Diesel is off to the beach with his owner Rayane so Rayane can try out the new metal detector he got for his birthday. Rayane is deaf, which means he doesnt hear everything, and Diesels super ears are trained to alert Rayane to important sounds he might miss. Diesel is Rayanes ears! Rayane and Diesel have been practising with the metal detector in the garden. At the beach, Diesel helps Mum find the perfect spot for a picnic. Then Rayane and Diesel head off with their metal detector in search of some treasure. They find a harmonica, a spoon, some coins, a metal clip and then… a set of car keys. They head back up the beach to find Mum, and together they set off to reunite the missing car keys with their owner. Can Diesels super ears save the day again?

programme.title: Dog Squad
programme.desc: Kika and Dr Amit head to the florist to buy flowers for Amits wife Seema. But theyll need some help from the top secret bumpy bits - the clever dots and lines on the pavement that contain secret messages for visually impaired people - and their guide dogs. First, Kika and Amit have to find the footpath, which is next to a cycle lane. Then, Kika guides Amit down the steps to the crossing near the flower shop, which has a tail of bumpy bits all the way across the pavement. But on their way back, Kika finds the crossing blocked by a fallen tree branch. She has to engage her super sit, where she refuses to continue until its safe. Kika summons her super sight once more and sets off in search of a different crossing to get Amit and his flowers home safely.

The chef also visits Anima Gardens, an exotic garden filled with sculptures and ceramics, before heading to Al Fassia restaurant, where all the staff are women. At home in his East Cork kitchen, Rory makes a Moroccan orange and almond cake

programme.title: Donals Real Time Recipes
programme.desc: Donal Skehan demonstrates how to cook signature, no-fuss recipes for busy weeknights, proving that dinner doesnt need to be complicated. The series comes hand-in-hand with the chefs latest cookbook, featuring 90 family favourites in 30 minutes or less, from pasta heroes like chop tomato pesto pasta and spicy nduja carbonara to one-pot wonders like saffron chicken and rice

programme.desc: The latest national and international news

programme.title: Build Your Own Home
programme.desc: Young couple Sean and Jess OTuama from County Limerick are restoring a parochial house in rural County Limerick to its former glory. They plan to do some major structural repairs, tear apart the inside, reveal the original stonework and design their own kitchen and bedrooms. When the couple start peeling back layers of old plasterwork they realise that they have more work on their hands than they envisaged

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Though from Essex, Olly Murs is actually a quarter-Latvian. His late grandfather Eddie was from Latvia, but Olly knows very little about this side of the family and wants to find out more. The singer travels to the circus in Riga, where his great-grandfather Eduard worked. Olly meets the circuss archivist Elvira Avota, who shows him documents relating to his great-grandfather and his wife Katrine and their extraordinary double act. At the Latvian State Archives, historian Daina Bleiere shows him documents that relate to his great-grandmother. Olly discovers that in 1951 Veronika was put on trial, accused of making anti-Soviet statements

programme.title: Beyond Paradise
programme.desc: When a priest from a Catholic boarding school suddenly disappears, Humphrey and Esther find that the case bears uncanny similarities to local myth The Devil on the Rocks. With a large sum of money missing from the school safe, the headmistress reluctant to aid the investigation and the priest nowhere to be found, the team members have their work cut out trying to pin down the truth. Meanwhile, Zoe helps Martha clean up Ten Mile Kitchen after a break-in, Annes new flame helps her move onto the Lily Bond, as Humphrey and Martha take over her house. Drama, starring Kris Marshall, Sally Bretton and Zahra Ahmadi

programme.title: The Great Pretenders
programme.desc: Exploring the vibrant and increasingly popular tribute band scene in Ireland from the perspective of the musicians and the fans. This programme follows the stories of the band members as they try to replicate the sound and the look of music legends, while offering viewers a chance to witness individual stories of dedication and expert musicianship

programme.title: Deaf Not Dumb
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the challenges of deaf education in Ireland, using stories of deaf children and their parents, such as an eight-year-old whose parents have fought for years to ensure he has the same access to education as others. The programme also examines how three deaf students who attended school in the 1950s were forced to learn to speak and lipread

programme.title: From that Small Island
programme.sub-title: New Worlds: The First Irish Diaspora
programme.desc: The documentary piecing together the jigsaw of Irelands earliest inhabitants focuses on the century from 1600 to 1700, when continental Europe was the main destination for tens of thousands of Irish migrants. This was the first Irish diaspora

programme.title: European Qualifier for FIFA World Cup
programme.desc: Republic of Ireland v Armenia (Kick-off 7.45pm). All the action from the Group F match at Aviva Stadium. The Republic are looking to avenge a shock 2-1 defeat in last months reverse fixture in Yerevan that dealt a major blow to their hopes of qualifying. However, they did claim a 3-2 win when the teams last met here in a 2022 UEFA Nations League contest, with Robbie Brady scoring the winner from the penalty spot in the first minute of second half stoppage time, just after the Armenians had seen two players receive red cards. Commentary comes from Darragh Maloney and Stephen Kelly

programme.title: Amanda and Alans Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr join forces to renovate the last two rooms. Their dream of creating an open plan living and dining room is dented when they discover the main structural wall dividing the two spaces requires a much smaller arch than they anticipated. For this final space, they agree to put their design differences to one side, but a disagreement over the shape of the arch threatens to divide them. Away from the task, the duo take a boat trip along the stunning Zingaro nature reserve to get inspiration from the Sicilian landscape, and enjoy sunset on horseback in the ancient Greek city of Selinunte

programme.title: Amanda and Alans Italian Job
programme.desc: Many hands make light work as Amanda Holden and Alan Carr invite local friends Fabrizio, Maria Pia and Carlos over for a plastering party, but things soon get out of hand as a spillage nearly ruins their newly laid terrazzo floor. On a shopping trek in the coastal city of Trapani, Amanda seeks modern soft furnishings for the living room, while Alan hunts for antique knick-knacks in the old town. Both reunite to style the newly designed space and reveal their labour of love, aka Casa Alamanda, to their Sicilian family

programme.title: First Dates Hotel
programme.desc: Architecture student Priti has trouble finding a man in the academic world and wants someone older, rugged and tattooed. No stranger to the tattooists chair is Australian entrepreneur Nick - but will the age gap end up being a problem for these two singletons? programme.title: The Skinny Jab Revolution

While over in Hollywood, celebrities are shrinking before the eyes of the public, the medications are flying off the pharmacy shelves in Ireland. Kathryn asks, with 24 per cent of people in the obese range, will almost a quarter of the Irish population be medicated?
