programme.title: Gogglebox Ireland
programme.desc: Deirdre OKane provides the voiceover as a selection of telly addicts comment on the weeks programmes from the comfort of their living rooms

programme.title: Faithless
programme.desc: Its a day of mixed emotions as the headstone is finally set at Tracys graveside. Lina has a new boyfriend in college, while Sam realises he likes Nancys teacher. Comedy drama, starring Baz Ashmawy and Suzie Seweify

programme.title: The Tonight Show
programme.desc: A unique take on the big stories of the day with a panel of guests. There is also a panel discussion covering the key issues in the news

programme.title: A Rebel Education
programme.desc: A look inside the joyous, complicated and messy world of secondary school education. Filmed over an academic year, this documentary follows the students navigating the most formative years of their lives. In this episode, Principal Burke is challenged by disruptive second year Kalen, Mr O Donovan tackles the impact of social media and former drop-out Alannah struggles to catch up for her leaving certificate

programme.title: Dont Look Back in Anger
programme.desc: Archive news stories from 2002, the year of Roy Keanes famous spat with Mick McCarthy, igniting a national debate that continues to this day. Bertie Ahern led Fianna Fail to victory in the general election but fell just short of an overall majority and a levy of 15 per cent was introduced on plastic bags

programme.title: Dont Look Back in Anger
programme.desc: Headline stories from 2003, accompanied by the music of the time

programme.title: World on Fire
programme.desc: As thousands flee Nazi-occupied Belgium, Harry, Stan and the rest of their unit take the last route out of France - the road to Dunkirk, where Grzegorz fights his way to the front of a queue to board a boat - only to be thrown back by angry soldiers. In Manchester, Douglas finds solace in his rapport with Jan, as his growing anxiety about Tom pushes him to the brink, while in Berlin the Rosslers grow ever more fearful for Hilda. Second World War drama, starring Sean Bean, Helen Hunt and Blake Harrison

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Abandoned by his wife and faced with financial ruin, local farmer Richard Harvey finally reaches the end of his tether, and heads into Aidensfield to air his grievances in a particularly memorable way. Meanwhile, the arrival of a handsome stranger sets Ginas heart racing - but he could be a dangerous criminal. Vernon and David branch out into a new line of business, and soon manage to pep up a few palates with Aunt Beths tangy horseradish sauce

programme.title: Marcus Wareings Tales from a Kitchen Garden
programme.desc: Setting out to bring in new livestock and expand the range of produce, the chef plans to bring in some ducks. But things arent as simple as they seem as Marcus heads out onto the lake to create a new home for them

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: Sophie, the wife of one of Kerseys friends, goes missing after an evening class and soon her tutor is found murdered. The detectives step in to investigate but the clues lead to standing stones linked to the entrance to hell in local superstition. Jack Shepherd and Helen Masters star

programme.title: The Deal Makers
programme.desc: Following the biggest characters from the world of pawn broking as they uncover the stories behind the most amazing objects being bought, sold and loaned against

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A policewoman is murdered, and when a blood-soaked shoe is found in a suspects wardrobe, it seems to be an open-and-shut case - but Kavanagh is not convinced the right man is in the dock. John Thaw stars

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: The Darling Buds of May - Part One
programme.desc: The first episode of the whimsical rural drama based on HE Bates novels. Tax collector Cedric Charlton visits the Larkin household intent on getting the head of the family - Pop - to correctly fill out his tax forms. In so doing he falls for attractive daughter Mariette. Starring David Jason, Pam Ferris and Catherine Zeta-Jones

programme.title: Judge Rinders Crime Stories
programme.desc: Barrister Robert Rinder examines the case of Gary Nelson, who murdered a bouncer and a community police officer in 1993, and was the subject of a 13-year investigation to bring him to justice for the killings

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An infamous London gangster arrives in the area to try to rebuild his life after prison, but Sergeant Miller has other ideas. Meanwhile, Peg starts a salmonella outbreak in Aidensfield when her miracle chicken feed scam goes awry

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Ruth Watson visits Langtry Manor Hotel in Bournemouth, which was built in 1877 for King Edward VII in honour of his mistress Lillie Langtry, and later turned into a hotel. Ruth immediately cites the buildings painted brickwork as off-putting, while outdated decor and imprudent budgeting add to her horror, as she points out why the business is squandering potential profits

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Nicola and Jimmy are anxious about Carls impending police interview, Moira is struggling with Cains absence, and Victoria reminds Robert he still needs to tell Aaron about Kev

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Theo is green with envy when Todd opens up to Billy instead of him and Tyrone pushes himself too far with his exercises. Kevin is down in the dumps when Abi cancels his day with Alfie after seeing how angry and upset he is and Tim tells Sally he wont be seeing Trisha again

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Theo is green with envy when Todd opens up to Billy instead of him and Tyrone pushes himself too far with his exercises. Kevin is down in the dumps when Abi cancels his day with Alfie after seeing how angry and upset he is and Tim tells Sally he wont be seeing Trisha again

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Carolines father Henry suggests turning off her life-support machine, presenting Dr Ormerod with a dilemma. Goodwin puts his career on the line by allowing a holistic therapist to treat a back injury and student nurse Samantha Beaumont is less than impressed by a date with theatre technician Alun Morris. Medical drama, starring Robert Daws, Michael Jayston and Amy Robbins

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Hathaway appears to have got over his fear of Lewis treading over his newly promoted toes. Their opposites have attracted in the past, and there seems no reason to suspect that they wont now the younger man has got used to the idea of his former mentor coming out of retirement to lend him a hand. Even DS Maddox isnt getting on Hathaways nerves quite as much, so this rejuvenated trio sets out to discover who murdered American classics student Rose Anderson, whose body has been hauled from the canal with neck and abdomen wounds. Nevertheless, a few red herrings threaten to get in their way of landing the killer. Kevin Whately, Laurence Fox and Angela Griffin star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Alf poses as a criminal as part of an undercover operation, but his covert actions only reveal startling information about Millers ethical beliefs. David eyes up Peggys room when she applies to be Lord Ashfordlys housekeeper - but both are left disappointed when the interview is a complete failure. Rural drama, starring William Simons, John Duttine, David Stockwell and Gwen Taylor

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Respected surgeon Dan Marsden is shot dead days before his retirement and his teenage daughters Mira and Karen are abducted. Joined by a new addition to the ranks, Vera investigates a mysterious parcel and a connection to the Iraq War as she races against time to catch the killer and save the girls. However, the case soon takes a violent and unexpected turn, striking at the heart of the team. Guest starring Saskia Reeves (Luther) and Dean Andrews (Ashes to Ashes), with Brenda Blethyn, David Leon and Gareth Farr

programme.title: Piste Noire
programme.desc: Corto is found alive and interrogated, and following a neighbourhood investigation, the caravans body is identified as an employee of the hotel of Boris Arnoux. In French

programme.title: Autopsy USA
programme.desc: An investigation into the untimely death of American actress Dana Plato, who starred in 1980s sitcom Diffrent Strokes

programme.title: Schitts Creek
programme.desc: Moiras estranged sister Deedee pays an unexpected visit, while Jocelyn asks David to talk to a new student who is struggling to fit in with his classmates

programme.title: Schitts Creek
programme.desc: Johnny tries to arrange a surprise birthday party for Moira, but things backfire when she unwittingly takes over the planning of her own celebration

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Bellamy thinks hes pulled off quite a coup when he spies a dangerous armed robber, but the villain makes his escape and embarks on a desperate hunt for a fast car to steal. Meanwhile, Mertons singer-songwriter cousin arrives, looking for the peace and quiet she needs to work, but her pregnant daughter soon puts paid to that idea. Lulu guest stars

programme.title: Marcus Wareings Tales from a Kitchen Garden
programme.desc: The chef makes plans to expand the herb patch at his smallholding, while gardener Anatoli shows him how to look after his bees and harvest the honey. Once the new herbs are in place, Marcus cooks up a feast for the people who have helped him along the way

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: A climber plunges to his death from a cliff face and a police informant claims it was no accident. A re-enactment of the incident adds fuel to the fire, and Wycliffe braces himself to interview the dead mans best friend. Drama, starring Jack Shepherd, Helen Masters, Lynn Farleigh, Christian Solimeno and Paul Venables

programme.title: The Deal Makers
programme.desc: Following the biggest characters from the world of pawn broking as they uncover the stories behind the most amazing objects being bought, sold and loaned against

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: Julia is assigned a compensation case brought by a man who has sustained spinal and brain damage in an accident at work, and tries to persuade Kavanagh to lead her. Unfortunately, he already has his hands full with a tricky compensation case and son Matts attempts to get the better of him. John Thaw stars, with Ned Sherrin, Frances Tomelty and TP McKenna

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: The Darling Buds of May - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Taxman Charley decides to escape from the office and go strawberry-picking with Mariette and the rest of the Larkin family - a move that leaves his career hanging in the balance. Light-hearted drama based on the novels by HE Bates, starring David Jason, Pam Ferris, Philip Franks and Catherine Zeta-Jones

programme.title: Judge Rinders Crime Stories
programme.desc: Barrister Robert Rinder examines two distinct cases - a home intrusion where the homeowner shot an intruder who was later linked to a murder and the parents of a child killed by a driver under the influence fighting to change the legal system

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Alf poses as a criminal as part of an undercover operation, but his covert actions only reveal startling information about Millers ethical beliefs. David eyes up Peggys room when she applies to be Lord Ashfordlys housekeeper - but both are left disappointed when the interview is a complete failure. Rural drama, starring William Simons, John Duttine, David Stockwell and Gwen Taylor

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Ruth Watson travels to Newquay in Cornwall in a bid to improve the Key West Hotel, owned by Brian and Gill Scott, who opened the establishment as part of their retirement plans. However, it is constantly overrun with stag and hen parties that leave a path of destruction in their wake, and the couple are reaching the end of their tether

programme.title: Wild Britain
programme.desc: Cameras follow dramatic events at a grey seal colony in Norfolk, as bulls fight over the in-season females. Meanwhile in Anglesey, guillemots are setting up home on precarious ledges, where their eggs will be safe from foxes and stoats

programme.title: Dont Look Back in Anger
programme.desc: Archive news documentary looking back at the headline stories of the past 20 years, focusing this week on 2015

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Goodwins medical skills are brought into question when he wrongly accuses a cafe of making a local jazz band ill and a dinner party turns murderous for Ormerod and Weatherill when their host reveals his wife is trying to kill him. The Health Authority announce plans to reorganise management at the Royal, leaving Mr Harper less than keen to reapply for his job, so Ken and Alun hit upon a plan to convince him otherwise

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: A case from 13 years earlier returns to haunt Lewis when the evidence comes under review. Graham Lawrie was incarcerated in a secure psychiatric hospital after being found guilty of the murders of three police officers, but now the findings of the forensics lab have been called into question and an appeal has been launched. As Lawrie remains locked up ahead of his day in court, PC Mark Travis is lured to an isolated location with a hoax call and falls victim to a killer who uses the same weapon as that used in the original murders

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A gang of youths push Peggy down a hole while shes poaching. Lord Ashfordly alerts Miller, who gives chase - but lands himself in trouble when he knocks down an elderly pedestrian. However, the incident gives Peggy a new money-making idea - shell sue for the injury she sustained in the fall. Meanwhile, Gina is attracted to her handsome college tutor. Tim Brooke-Taylor and Murray Head guest star

programme.title: Code of Silence
programme.desc: Determined to keep her meeting with Liam secret, Alison doesnt tell the police about him taking her to AandE. Meanwhile, tensions flare at the Canterbury Tap as Liams arrival leads to a confrontation with Alisons ex Eithan, who pleads with her for a second chance. The police eventually find out about Alisons meeting with Liam and fire her due to her reckless actions, but she decides to take control of her own destiny when Liam invites her to a gang-linked meeting in London.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot
